content: Mohammad Mohammadi - Queen's University Belfast View Scopus Profile Mohammad Mohammadi Dr Lecturer, School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6942-988X Emailm.mohammadiqub.acuk 20132025 Research activity per year Personal profile Research InterestsCell-Free Massive MIMOMassive (large-scale) MIMO systemsIntegrate Sensing and CommunicationsPhysical layer security for Massive MIMOFull-duplex CommunicationsOtherMohammadali Mohammadi (Senior Member, IEEE) is currently a Lecturer at  the Queen’s University Belfast, U.K. Prior to this, he held academic positions as an Assistant Professor and subsequently as an Associate Professor at Shahrekord University, Iran. Before joining Queen’s University Belfast, he was a Research Fellow the Centre for Wireless Innovation (CWI), Queen’s University Belfast, from 2021 to 2024. He received his Ph.D. degree in Wireless Communication Engineering from K.N. Toosi University of Technology, Iran, in September 2012. His research interests include signal processing for wireless communications, cell-free massive MIMO, integrated sensing and communication (ISAC), reconfigurable intelligent surfaces (RIS), and physical layer security. He has authored more than 80 peer-reviewed publications in international journals and conferences and has co-authored two invited book chapters. Dr. Mohammadi currently serves as an Associate Editor for IEEE Communications Letters and the IEEE Open Journal of the Communications Society. He received the Exemplary Reviewer Award from IEEE Transactions on Communications in 2020 and 2022, and from IEEE Communications Letters in 2023. He has served on the Technical Program Committees of several flagship IEEE conferences, including ICC, GLOBECOM, and VTC. Fingerprint Dive into the research topics where Mohammad Mohammadi is active.
